TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {12756=(Andhra Pradesh Vikalagula Cooperative Corporation was set up in the year 1981 in the international year of the disabled to look after the welfare of the handicapped. A separate directorate for the welfare of the handicapped came into existence in 1983. These two organisations are working for the betterment of the disabled in the state).}
textBeforeTable: In Govt. jobs: In Gr "C" and "D" posts under the Govt., reservation are provided in direct recruitment for physically handicapped persons as indicated below: Reservation New Delhi - 1 Kasturba Gandhi Marg 1, Canning Lane Govt. of N.C.T of Delhi Concerned Officer: The Deputy Director Deptt. of Social Welfare DELHI Other concession: The State Govt. has provided free ferry boat/launcher at various points of Goa. Assistance for purchase of aids & appliances: Under this scheme, aids and appliances like hearing aid, artificial limbs shoes, wheel chair, tricycle etc. are provided to the disabled persons through 'Caritas Goa' which is a recognized organization. For other details, please see 'Key References' at Appendix-A Setting of kiosks Cottage industries Purchase of typewriter Tailoring shop Cycle shop Assistance for self employment: Financial assistance of Rs.2,500/- to Rs.8,000/- is given for the following five economic activities: Bus Concession: Free for disabled students in private and Govt. buses and 50% concession is provided for escorts of eligible handicapped persons. Rs. 250/- P.M. Family Income Rs. 60/- P.M. Per Capita Income 60 years & above Age
textAfterTable: In Educational Institutions: 3% seats in I.T.I's are reserved for the physically handicapped persons. Others: 5% reservation in allotment of DDA shops/kiosks 1% reservation in DDA plots 2% reservation in Municipal shops Age relaxation: The upper age limit is relaxed by 10 years for handicapped persons for applying in Govt. jobs.
